ae_vanilla module

Vanilla Autoencoder to reduce dimensionality of images

ae_vanilla.initialize_weights(net_l, scale=1) → None[source]
class ae_vanilla.vanilla_autoencoder(device: torch.device, hp: Dict[str, Any], snapshot_dir: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

compute_loss(x_batch: Union[torch.Tensor, numpy.ndarray], y_batch: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None) → torch.Tensor[source]

Compute loss for the forward pass.

Parameters

  • x_batch (Union[torch.Tensor, np.ndarray]) – he input image data. If the input data type is np.ndarray, the method automatically converts it into torch.Tensor.

  • y_batch (torch.Tensor, optional) – The input image label. Defaults to None (Not used in ae_vanilla.vanilla_autoencoder).

Returns

Loss computed between the original and the reconstructed image. By default, we use torch.nn.MSELoss.

Return type

torch.Tensor

construct_decoder() → Tuple[torch.nn.modules.container.Sequential, torch.nn.modules.container.Sequential][source]

Construct decoder based on the model hyperparameters.

Returns

Tuple of convolutional layers and the fully connected layers (dec_conv, dec_fc) in the decoder.

Return type

Tuple[nn.Sequantial, nn.Sequantial]

construct_encoder() → Tuple[torch.nn.modules.container.Sequential, torch.nn.modules.container.Sequential][source]

Construct encoder based on the model hyperparameters.

Returns

Tuple of convolutional layers and the fully connected layers (enc_conv, enc_fc) in the encoder.

Return type

Tuple[nn.Sequantial, nn.Sequantial]

early_stopping() → bool[source]

Stops the model training if the model does not show improvement for a specified number of consecutive epochs, determined by the value of self.early_stopping_limit (default: 20 epochs).

Returns

True if the early stopping limit was exceeded; False otherwise.

Return type

bool

predict(dataloader: torch.utils.data.dataloader.DataLoader) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]

Generate predictions using the autoencoder model on the entire dataset provided by the specified DataLoader.

Parameters

Returns

save_best_loss_model(valid_loss: float) → None[source]

Stores the current model if it achieves the lowest validation loss; otherwise, it increases self.epochs_no_improve by 1.

Parameters

valid_loss (float) – Validation loss at the current epoch.

save_loss(epoch: int) → None[source]

train_batch(x_batch: torch.Tensor, y_batch: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None) → float[source]

Train the model on a batch of inputs.

Parameters

  • y_batch (torch.Tensor, optional) – Batch of input labels. Defaults to None.

Train the vanilla autoencoder.

Parameters

  • num_epoch (int) – Total number of training epochs.

  • trainloader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – PyTorch DataLoader with the training set.

  • validloader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – PyTorch DataLoader with the validation set.

training: bool
